result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim M. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo a mental health assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any recommended treatment/comply with her mental health/psychiatry appointments within 33 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall have no contact with R.M., D.M or their residences.

Defendant shall take all mediations as prescribed and shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription in her own name.

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.

The Diversion Agreement may be terminated after 2 years if the defendant has successfully completed all of the conditions of the agreement.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Defendant shall pay restitution and 10% restitution surcharge in an amount to be determined within 33 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.  Defendant shall make payments to the Monroe County Clerk of Courts Office.

supervisions.notes: PAY RESTITUTION OF $411.70 AND RESTITUTION SURCHARGE OF $41.17 FOR A TOTAL OF $452.87.

PAY COSTS OF $528.00

PP $50.00 PER MONTH COMMENCING MARCH 1, 2020 AND ON THE 1ST DAY OF EACH MONTH THEREAFTER
